txt.en: 'Far to the south, into the crumbling remains of Dol Guldur, Karazgar fled in agony....'
'He rests among the lingering evils of the Necromancer, and there reflects upon his failure.'
'He knows not his true self, his prisoner eludes him, and his strength falters....'
'A cold-drake of the Ered Mithrin comes....'
'What he seeks has been denied him, but his thoughts betray a new malice.'
'In vengeance and greed, Vethúg shall cast his shadow upon the mountain....'
Instance: Of Dreams and Desires
'He did not behold the Elder Days and he is young, still, in the years of the world....'
'You seek the Herald of Winter, and you shall soon know her.'
'But it is his fate that shall rule the fates of many others.'
'When he stood before me, I knew the mind of the one you call the Weeping Warrior.'
'Hrímil she is named, and in the Elder Days, she served Morgoth freely....'
'But the will of Sauron could not compel her, and he bade Karazgar imprison her.'
'Sauron is defeated and the Mordath shattered, but her jailor has escaped her wrath.'
'To her frozen hordes, Hrímil is the last remnant of the Great Enemy.'
'And they serve her will alone.'
'Three visions I grant thee.'
'Of foes, of far-off lands, of futures uncertain....'
'He wields but a small measure of the might of his mother, Hrímil, but it is enough.'
'...of thy dreams and desires. Behold!'
